lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo Kharhi Khaat Khal Sabad Surati Heena , Moni Ko Mahaatamu Pai Anmrit Pravaah Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: An animal eats green grass and hay. He is bereft of all knowledge of Lord's word. Due to his inability to speak, gives nectar-like milk.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnw imstwn Kwn pwn mwns muK rsnw rsIlI hoie soeI BlI qwih jI
lines.transliteration_english: Naanaa Misataan Khaan Paan Maanas Moukha , Rasanaa Raseelee Hoi Soee Bhalee Taahi Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A man eats and enjoys many types of food materials with his tongue but he becomes praiseworthy only if his tongue is sweetened with the sweetness of Lord's name.

lines.gurmukhi: bcn ibbyk tyk mwns jnm Pl bcn ibhUn psu primiq Awih jI
lines.transliteration_english: Bachan Bibayk Tayk Maanas Janam Dhala , Bachan Bihoon Pasu Paramiti Aahi Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Purpose of human life is to take refuge in the meditation of His Naam. But one devoid of the teachings of the True Guru is the worst kind of animal.

lines.gurmukhi: mwns jnm giq bcn ibbyk hIn ibKDr ibKm ckq icqu cwih jI ]202]
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Janam Gati Bachan Bibayk Heena , Bikhadhar Bikham Chakat Chitu Chaahi Jee ?202?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is bereft of teachings of True Guru, craves and wanders in search of worldly pleasure and remains vexed for their acquisition. His state is like a dangerous poisonous snake. (202)
